ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
ygData.msgSnippet: No problem at all Shaisi :P Sometimes it makes me laugh at how worked up ALL of us get over a game. Personally, I m a little jealous that you broke out of the
ygData.messageBody:
No problem at all Shaisi :P
Sometimes it makes me laugh at how worked up ALL of us get over a game.
Personally, I'm a little jealous that you broke out of the never ending
guild raids etc. I'm getting a little fed up.. sure its fun doing "new"
things but is it really worth it to spend EVERY WAKING MOMENT online at huge
raids listening to 15 year olds (and 30 year olds) argue about loot?

Hmm sounding a little bitter aren't I?


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
> [mailto:garramone@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 10:37 AM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
>
>
> Ack, I'm sorry if I sound belligerent (to anyone), I just get
> worked up
> discussing this subject. I've always enjoyed talking to you Talani,
> didn't mean anything personally. Besides, this list is dead
> at least we
> are talking.
>
> We had only 1 shaman for a long time, but he is insane. If
> we had 6 he
> would not know what to do. They have 2 now, to ease his pain
> somewhat.
> I was not bored with my bard, if you are referring to me. I was not
> bored with the game, I was going through a strange time in my life, I
> quit because of RL not the game. I was only 59, so I still had a long
> bit of exp'ing to do, which is when bards are useful and fun. If I
> could go back, I would have left for those 10 weeks and not
> deleted, but
> I didn't think I would ever play again, and deleting was a
> way to ensure
> that (guess it didn't work). I play for fun and casually
> now, I do not
> want 60 nor be in AL again, I can not and do not want to raid
> 6 nights a
> week for 7 hours a night. I can raid for less, the only
> quais-mandatory
> raids (you can't really force someone to come eh?) are the 2 nights of
> clearing North ToV, but then I would be where I left, the
> bottom of the
> totem pole, which is not a good thing to be in AL. It's not
> for casual
> players.
>
> At the time I quit there were 4 bards in the guild: me, Thott, Jaco,
> Syren all 60 but me hehe. As of a week ago, there was 1
> bard, Thott. I
> quit, Syren moved and had no ISP for 4 months, and Jaco quit
> because he
> was tired of being in the buff group. So for 4 months AL had 1 bard
> (Syren just came back this week). If bards were as needed as many
> think, would AL of all guilds only have 1 bard for 4 months and have
> accomplished what they have?
>
> Shada/Erisi
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 9:13 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
>
>
> owie =/
> hehe
>
> Well I can see your points Shada, but I have to also say that
> I still do
> believe Bards are useful on raids. People say shaman are useful on
> raids..
> sure, 3 shaman are, but 6? If there are 6 shaman on our raids I just
> sit
> there and play Diablo on my other comp. (Hope nobody from my guild is
> reading this!) And again, I haven't played a bard on 40+
> person raids.
> I
> do know that our main Necro switched to the bard character of someone
> who
> had left the game (Iridis), and he is constantly amazed at
> how much more
> useful bards are than necros in group raids.
>
> *shrug*
> Maybe its that we all just get bored after a while?
>
> Halana/Tani
>
